alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bath; Bedford; Botetourt; Craig; Giles; Montgomery; Pulaski; Roanoke; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:02AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski, eastern Giles and Craig Counties in southwestern Virginia, southwestern Rockbridge, Botetourt, northern Roanoke, Alleghany and southwestern Bath Counties in west central Virginia, northwestern Bedford County in south central Virginia, northern Montgomery County in southwestern Virginia, southern Greenbrier, eastern Summers and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia and the City of Covington through 730 AM EDT... At 702 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roaring Mountain Summit, or near Alleghany, moving south at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Alleghany... Covington... Clifton Forge... Lewisburg... Pearisburg... and White Sulphur Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
